ClassDesc: A thread state. A thread can be in one of the following states: @B_java#lang#Thread#State#NEW_E@ A thread that has not yet started is in this state. @B_java#lang#Thread#State#RUNNABLE_E@ A thread executing in the Java virtual machine is in this state. @B_java#lang#Thread#State#BLOCKED_E@ A thread that is blocked waiting for a monitor lock is in this state. @B_java#lang#Thread#State#WAITING_E@ A thread that is waiting indefinitely for another thread to perform a particular action is in this state. @B_java#lang#Thread#State#TIMED_WAITING_E@ A thread that is waiting for another thread to perform an action for up to a specified waiting time is in this state. @B_java#lang#Thread#State#TERMINATED_E@ A thread that has exited is in this state. A thread can be in only one state at a given point in time. These states are virtual machine states which do not reflect any operating system thread states.
